content: Public incidents refer to events or situations that affect the general public, such as accidents, natural disasters, or civic issues. Reporting these incidents helps authorities respond quickly and efficiently.

To report a public incident: 1. Gather accurate information (location, time, description). 2. Take photos or videos if safe. 3. Use the official reporting platform or app. 4. Provide your contact details if follow-up is needed. 5. Submit the report and note the reference number.
Crowd reports are incident reports submitted by multiple individuals. They help verify the authenticity and urgency of an issue. Encourage others to report if they witness the same incident.
After a report is submitted, authorities may reach out for more information or to provide updates. Always respond promptly and provide any additional details requested.

Garbage accumulation can lead to health hazards and environmental issues. Report overflowing bins, illegal dumping, or missed collections to the municipal corporation with location details and photos.
Potholes can cause accidents and damage vehicles. Report potholes by specifying the exact location, size, and severity. Attach photos for better assessment by authorities.
